texts.definition: Information provided to players that extends beyond the observational abilities provided by simply observing game elements.
markups: <style="Definition">Information provided to players that extends beyond the observational abilities provided by simply observing game elements.</style>

The game elements positions and configuration in a game provide players with information about what they can do. However, complex game states - especially the ones which are maintained in a computer system - may not be able to directly present enough information to players in one continuous and perhaps diegetic presentation. In these cases, additional information can be provided to players through <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> which collect and present information in other ways.

Many <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Board%20Games">Board Games</link></style>, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Amun-Re">Amun-Re</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Carcassonne">Carcassonne</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominant%20Species">Dominant Species</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Inca%20Empire">Inca Empire</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Egizia">Egizia</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pictionary">Pictionary</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ursuppe">Ursuppe</link></style>, include <style="Link"><link="score-tracks">Score Tracks</link></style> that help players have a good overview of the positions of all players. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ludo">Ludo</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pachisi">Pachisi</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Snakes%20and%20Ladders">Snakes and Ladders</link></style> show how this overview can be the game board.

Computer-based <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Strategy%20Games">Strategy Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Age%20of%20Empires%20series">Age of Empires</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Civilization%20(video%20game)%20series">Civilization</link></style> series make use of <style="Link"><link="mini">Mini-maps</link></style> that allows players to have an overview of a larger part of the game world that would otherwise be possible. Similarly, most <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Racing%20Games">Racing Games</link></style>, e. g., the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Mario%20Kart%20series">Mario Kart series</link></style> and the Monkey Race party games in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Super%20Monkey%20Ball%20series">Super Monkey Ball series</link></style>, provide a small overhead map that shows the location of other players on the track.

<style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> are used in games to provide players with information about the game state, e.g. <style="Link"><link="area-control">Area Control</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Negotiation">Negotiation</link></style> contexts, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Perceivable%20Margins">Perceivable Margins</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="preventing-goals">Preventing Goals</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="player-defined-goals">Player Defined Goals</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="scores">Scores</link></style>, sometimes to help players know when <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attention%20Swapping">Attention Swapping</link></style> is required. This information may be to help players with <style="Link"><link="movement">Movement</link></style>, either directly with <style="Link"><link="game-world-exploration">Game World Exploration</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="game-world-navigation">Game World Navigation</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="reconnaissance">Reconnaissance</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="traverse">Traverse</link></style> goals or indirectly with positions in <style="Link"><link="races">Races</link></style>. For <style="Link"><link="combat">Combat</link></style> situation, it can provide players with help on <style="Link"><link="tactical-planning">Tactical Planning</link></style> where <style="Link"><link="camping">Camping</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="sniper-locations">Sniper Locations</link></style> are located while for <style="Link"><link="puzzle-solving">Puzzle Solving</link></style> it can modify <style="Link"><link="memorizing">Memorizing</link></style>. On a more general navigation level, this can be how <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style> are perceived or how <style="Link"><link="fog-war">Fog of War</link></style> functions. For games with <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> it can help players keep track of all the <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> under one's control while in those with <style="Link"><link="player-characters">Player Characters</link></style> it can instead help support <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Identification">Identification</link></style>. The presence of <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> are likely to affect how players interact with each other in <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style>, e.g. regarding <style="Link"><link="collaborative-actions">Collaborative Actions</link></style>, and well as how <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Perfect%20Information">Perfect</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Public%20Information">Public Information</link></style> is perceived. Of course, <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> can also provide information about <style="Link"><link="extra-game-actions">Extra-Game Actions</link></style> since this is part of the game interface which already is outside the diegesis in some way.

The basic elements for providing <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> are various <style="Link"><link="game-state-indicators">Game State Indicators</link></style>, e.g. <style="Link"><link="bookkeeping-tokens">Bookkeeping Tokens</link></style> (with <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Public%20Information">Public Information</link></style>), <style="Link"><link="geospatial-game-widgets">Geospatial Game Widgets</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="goal-indicators">Goal Indicators</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="near-miss-indicators">Near Miss Indicators</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="score-tracks">Score Tracks</link></style> (but publicly observable <style="Link"><link="scores">Scores</link></style> can work equally well). <style="Link"><link="auxiliary-game-screens">Auxiliary Game Screens</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="hud-interfaces">HUD Interfaces</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="mini">Mini-maps</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="picture-picture-views">Picture-in-Picture Views</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="split-screen-views">Split-Screen Views</link></style>, are more complex solutions which in themselves can provide <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> (<style="Link"><link="cutscenes">Cutscenes</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="narration-structures">Narration Structures</link></style> can also do this but often doesn't present game state information beyond acknowledging that a certain game state has been met since they have been initiated). <style="Link"><link="cameras">Cameras</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="god-views">God Views</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="third-person-views">Third-Person Views</link></style> let players have a form of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Game%20State%20Overview">Game State Overview</link></style> in that they are given some agency over what view they should have of the game state (this solution assumes that there is <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> that a player's point of observation can be manipulated within). <style="Link"><link="privileged-movement">Privileged Movement</link></style> which allows flying work similarly. <style="Link"><link="dedicated-game-facilitators">Dedicated Game Facilitators</link></style> (especially <style="Link"><link="game-masters">Game Masters</link></style>) can of course create <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> since they can completely control players' access to what parts of the game state they perceive.

<style="Link"><link="alarms">Alarms</link></style> can modify <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> by showing that certain closures are near occurring while <style="Link"><link="outcome-indicators">Outcome Indicators</link></style> can provide detailed information about closures that have occurred. <style="Link"><link="game-pauses">Game Pauses</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="turn-taking">Turn Taking</link></style> let players that have possibility of observing <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> without stress and can thereby make better use of the information they provide.

<style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> can work against several other design solutions since it can reveal too much information. Examples of patterns which can be negatively affected by <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> include <style="Link"><link="game-world-navigation">Game World Navigation</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Leaps%20of%20Faith">Leaps of Faith</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Foresight">Limited Foresight</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="memorizing">Memorizing</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="reconnaissance">Reconnaissance</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Surprises">Surprises</link></style>.

Since <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> often introduce non-diegetic game elements, e.g. through <style="Link"><link="geospatial-game-widgets">Geospatial Game Widgets</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="hud-interfaces">HUD Interfaces</link></style>, the pattern often works against <style="Link"><link="diegetic-consistency">Diegetic Consistency</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> typically work as <style="Link"><link="progress-indicators">Progress Indicators</link></style>. Since they can provide players with information about their own situation and that of other players, it can help provide <style="Link"><link="strategic-knowledge">Strategic Knowledge</link></style> and create <style="Link"><link="stimulated-planning">Stimulated Planning</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Cognitive%20Engrossment">Cognitive Engrossment</link></style>. This can in <style="Link"><link="turn-based-games">Turn-Based</link></style> <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style> cause <style="Link"><link="analysis-paralysis">Analysis Paralysis</link></style> but can also in <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style> have <style="Link"><link="balancing-effects">Balancing Effects</link></style> if either <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player%20Decided%20Results">Player Decided Results</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player-Decided%20Distributions">Player-Decided Distributions</link></style> exist. However since it can provide information about other aspects of the game state than what a player is currently engage with it can also cause <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Disruption%20of%20Focused%20Attention">Disruption of Focused Attention</link></style>.

Providing players with information about their own and other players' positions can cause them to perceive the gameplay as <style="Link"><link="races">Races</link></style>, and make players try <style="Link"><link="speedending">Speedending</link></style> the games if it is to their advantage. When the <style="CurrentLink">Game State Overviews</style> are available to others than the players, it supports games to have <style="Link"><link="spectators">Spectators</link></style>.
